intro: Mayna pacifica, commonly known as the Pacific mayna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that can range in color from white to pink and purple. Its leaves are broad and heart-shaped, often with a waxy surface. Mayna pacifica is typically found in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or loamy soils with ample sunlight.
